question.body: How can the unmodified stomach expand?

multiple_choice.choice: the fundus expands into the esophagus

response.feedback: Correct. Rugae smooth out to add some increased volume, and the walls also distend with smooth muscle cells.
Incorrect. Rugae can expand outward, but the function of gastric pits is to secrete material.
Incorrect. Sphincters keep food in the stomach, but they do not cause shape changes.
Incorrect. The stomach distends outward but not into the esophagus or duodenum.

part.hint: The stomach is permanently bounded on each end, so it can only expand outward.
